title: Corrections & Amplifications
text:
About 2,100 new hires made by JPMorgan Chase & Co. in 2020 had criminal records. An article Wednesday about a New York state bill to automatically expunge the records of people convicted of crimes incorrectly said around 10% of 2,100 new hires made by the company in 2020 had criminal records.

(See: "Criminal Records Bill Considered --- Legislation would remove records for some crimes after sentences are done" -- WSJ

---

Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by e-mailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
